outputs.output_descr: The Police and Prisons Project is intended to contribute to the UNDP Country Programme Outcome on support to strengthening institutional capacity of Rule of Law Institutions, and promoting rule of law in Southern Sudan, as well as the United Nations Development Assistance Framework (UNDAF).  This project aims to support the priority of the Government of Southern Sudan (GOSS) on implementation of the CPA and peaceful resolution of conflicts in Southern Sudan through the creation of an enabling environment for the promotion and protection of human rights and the rule of law after decades of conflict and insecurity

This project aims to support the priority of the government on implementation of the CPA and peaceful resolution of conflicts in Southern Sudan through supporting training and organizational development of the Correction Services in Southern Sudan

The project aims to enhance capacity of Police through training and campaigns as well provide logistical support to the Prisons on sewage management hence promoting sanitation of Prisons in Southern Sudan.
Project  Management - Monitoring and Evaluation - Rehabilitation of Police and Prisons Infrastructure
Professional Police Force for Southern Sudan Trained Through the Academy and other established institutions.
Professional Police Force for Southern Sudan Trained Through the Academy and other established institutions.
